title: The Caves of Androzani
dialogue_triumphs: Jek's reaction on finally confronting the partner who betrayed him: 'Do you think bullets could stop me now? You stinking offal Morgus, look at me!'
goofs: Krau Timmin's handheld computer is clearly a TV remote control.
In the android's view of the Doctor, his hearts are clearly outside his coat.

In episode three, when the Doctor rips one of the handles off the ship's wall, and it flies across the room, you can still see the handle attached to the chain, dangling from the Doctor's wrist, if you slow the sequence down.
The sound of the machine guns firing interferes with the image on screen.
Peri falls into a spectrox nest and bounces.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor's celery
continuity_notes.description: An accessory worn by the Fifth Doctor that serves as an early warning system for certain gases.
continuity_notes.current_status: Explained as an allergy detector for gases in the Praxis range.

continuity_notes.name: Morgus
continuity_notes.description: The richest man in the Five Planets, chairman of the Sirius Conglomerate.

continuity_notes.name: Spectrox
continuity_notes.description: The most valuable substance in the universe, capable of halting the aging process.
continuity_notes.current_status: Highly sought after, but toxic in raw form

continuity_notes.name: Adric
continuity_notes.description: A former companion of the Doctor
continuity_notes.current_status: Mentioned as the Fifth Doctor's final word before regeneration

continuity_notes.name: Sixth Doctor
continuity_notes.description: The next incarnation of the Doctor
continuity_notes.current_status: First appears at the end of the regeneration scene

technobabble: Sharaz Jek's androids are programmed to kill humans unless they are wearing a belt-plate which 'emits low frequency magma waves or even a neutrino pattern keyed to the android spectrum length'.
roots: Philip K. Dick's The Three Stigmata of Palmer Eldritch
The Shape of Things to Come (1978)

locations.name: Androzani Major
locations.description: One of the two planets in the Androzani system

locations.name: Androzani Minor
locations.description: One of the two planets in the Androzani system, source of spectrox
locations.current_status: Unchanged since the Doctor's previous visit

untold_adventures: The Doctor has been 'this way before' and says that Androzani Minor 'hasn't changed'.
additional_notes: Peter Davison's performance is astonishing. Colin Baker is the first Doctor to get a line at the end of his regeneration scene ('Change my dear, and it seems not a moment too soon').
bottom_line: A triumph of style over substance, 'The Caves of Androzani' is brilliant but over-rated. Its unique place in Doctor Who mythology is assured, however, by a story in which the only survivors of a male blood-bath are Peri and Timmin.
